module.name: pygame2.sdl.cdrom
module.desc: The cdrom module manages the CD and DVD drives on a computer. It can also control the playback of audio CDs.

class.name: CD
class.desc:
Creates a new :class:`CD` object for the CD- or DVD-ROM specified by the passed *index*. The *index* identifies the matching system CD/DVD-ROM number as returned by cdrom.num_drives ().
The :class:`CD` itself provides access to the track data on the CD/DVD, playing audio tracks, opening and closing the drive tray and so forth.

method.name: close
method.desc: Releases the :class:`CD` internals. Useful for e.g. switching CDs within the drive without the need to recreate the :class:`CD` object. CD.open() will reinitialize the:class:`CD` internals. You should not use any other method or attribute until a call to :meth:`open`.

attr.name: cur_frame
attr.desc: The current frame offset within the curent track.

attr.name: index
attr.desc: The drive index as specified in the constructor.

attr.name: num_tracks
attr.desc: The total number of tracks on the CD or DVD.

method.name: open
method.desc: (Re-)Opens the :class:`CD` and initialises the :class:`CD` internals after a :meth:`close` call.

method.name: play
method.desc: Starts playing the current :class:`CD` beginning at the give *start* time for a maximum of *length* seconds. The *start* and *length* arguments are handled as seconds by default. To use an exact frame offset instead ofseconds, pass True as third *asfps* parameter.

method.name: play_tracks
method.call: play_tracks ([starttrack, ntracks, start, length, asfps]) -> None
method.desc: Plays a certain number of tracks beginning at the passed start track. If *start* and *length* are not 0, *start* determines the offset of *starttrack* to begin the playback at and *length* specifies the amount of seconds to play from the last track within the track list. To use an exact frame offset instead of seconds for the *start* and *length* parameters, pass True as *asfps* parameter.

attr.name: tracks
attr.desc: Gets a list of :class:`CDTrack` objects with the CD track information.

class.name: CDTrack
class.desc: The :class:`CDTrack` class provides information about the track contents of a CD or DVD. It should not be created within user code.

attr.name: length
attr.desc: Gets the track length in frames.

attr.name: minutes
attr.desc: Gets the approximate track length in minutes.

attr.name: offset
attr.desc: Gets the frame offset of the track on the CD.

attr.name: seconds
attr.desc: Gets the approximate track length in seconds.

attr.name: time
attr.desc: Gets the approximate track length in minutes and seconds as tuple.

attr.name: type
attr.desc: Gets the track type (data or audio).

func.name: get_name
func.desc:
Gets the name of the specified CD- or DVD-ROM drive.
Gets the system-dependent drive name (e.g. "/dev/cdrom" or "D:") for the CD- or DVD-Rom specified by the passed *index*.

func.name: init
func.desc: Initializes the CD-ROM subsystem of the SDL library.

func.name: num_drives
func.desc: Gets the number of accessible CD- and DVD-ROM drives for the system.

func.name: quit
func.desc:
Shuts down the CD-ROM subsystem of the SDL library.
After calling this function, you should not invoke any class, method or function related to the CD-ROM subsystem as they are likely to fail or might give unpredictable results.

func.name: was_init
func.desc: Returns, whether the CD-ROM subsystem of the SDL library is initialized.
